term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - intramolecular isotope effect
term.title: intramolecular isotope effect

item.text: A kinetic isotopic effect observed when a single substrate, in which the isotopic atoms occupy equivalent reactive positions, reacts to produce a non-statistical distribution of isotopomeric products. In such a case the isotope effect will favour the pathway with lower force constants for displacement of the isotopic nuclei in the transition state.
